caption: Very weird hosts at the door.
Great food and service

I normally don't leave negative reviews, but I feel compelled to in this case. My wife and I were excited to try this place for takeout as the menu seemed interesting and had a lot of selection. Unfortunately, they messed up the spice level on our order, so several of the dishes that should have been spicy were mild and vice versa. Worse than that, we each found a scrap of plastic (pictured) in one of our dishes (2 out of 4 dishes). My wife also found a hair in one of her dishes. I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1 because the menu is interesting and the dessert dishes were good, but we will not be going back.
The food is amazing and ready super fast. The fact that a piece of naan does not come with a meal and it is $4 per piece is kind of disappointing though.
Great to have a new Indian spot in the neighborhood. Enjoyed trying the chaat.

I was very excited to try this new restaurant in DTSS, since the options for Indian food are lacking in the area. I specifically asked prior to ordering if there are any nuts in the Shahi Paneer. I was told no, all dishes with nuts have a symbol next to it on the menu. I go home and take a bite, and have an allergic reaction. Dug through the curry to find a couple cashews at the bottom.  This happens far too often to people like myself with allergies, so it’s almost pointless to want to take it up in court. However, it’s how you lose business from myself and my family forever. Probably won’t hurt them since these types of businesses don’t care at all, they just want to sell their food.
Wanted to try the new place nearby, it was really really good. Just ordered some classics and they were great!
Good some biryani and was very generic tasting.  Not much flavor and samosas were very oily. Wouldn’t recommend the biryani
We ordered 5 items off the menu and there wasn’t one item that we didn’t enjoy! Welcome to Silver Spring, we’ll be back soon!

These folks have guts opening a place against the headwinds of COVID. But when I tried the food I realized they know how to make amazing Indian food. Right now it's just take-out since there is no dine-in. I had a chicken curry with basmati rice, it was so good! I look forward to dining in this space once the curse of COVID is done.

This is some of the best Indian food I've ever had! We live in the downtown Silver Spring neighborhood where there is no shortage of excellent food. Spice Street is a welcomed addition. They've been open for about a month and a half and we've already ordered from there four times. Safe to say this place is easily a favorite.

We arrived at this spot for dinner. my friend recommended this restaurant.  Well, it was a winning. the staff members were so friendly and we felt very good. The food was just great. We enjoyed every moment and we will visit this place again. Recommended.

Amazing food! I’m impressed - can’t wait to order here again. I went for comfort food, and their chicken tikka masala was delicious! Definitely going to be a go-to in our house. Their menu has a lot of innovative dishes, and so many things I’ve never tried, so next time I’ll be ordering something totally new to me.  The interior is gorgeous, too - sleek and mellow. When it’s safer, we’ll definitely be coming here for a glass of wine at the bar.

Really good! We ordered a bunch of entrees and everything was flavorful, not too spicy or heavy, good portion size. Some unique items you don’t see on the usual menu (loved the cheesy Bombay toast and the kati rolls). Next time will order extra-spicy to see how their hotter flavors hold up.

We were very impressed by our first try of this restaurant. Food was aromatic, not at all greasy, and the lamb and tofu were of perfect tenderness. The online order/payment system is easy and prices are reasonable. Nice to have this restaurant in our downtown Silver Spring neighborhood!
Too salty, Small portions, moong halwa wasn't halwa at all

Been craving Indian cuisine recently and saw Spice Street was opening this week so gave them a try. Could not believe how delicious the food was! We got Palak Paneer, Lamb Methiwala, and garlic naan. It was absolutely heavenly and the pickup experience was a breeze. This will definitely be part of our regular takeout rotation. Highly, highly recommend!
Delicious food, fast, easy to order delivery from their website. I can't wait to try other items from their menu (I had lamb methiwala and will definitely order that again too).
Amazing menu. We loved it. Can't wait to try again.

Got takeout here the first day they opened. They were a bit slow, but it was the first day and they seemed busy, so I don't hold that against them. The food was great, especially the Chicken Korma! Look forward to trying more menu items here.
